A contract or other agreement relating to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> (including a home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>) may not be applied or interpreted to bar a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> from bringing a claim in court pursuant to any provision of law for damages or other relief in connection with any alleged violation of any Federal law. This prohibition does not limit a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or any assignee from agreeing, after a dispute or claim under the transaction arises, to settle or use arbitration or other non-judicial procedure to resolve that dispute or claim.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j
paragraph.title: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.
paragraph.content: Policies and procedures to ensure and monitor compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-1
paragraph.content: A depository institution must establish and maintain written policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure and monitor the compliance of the depository institution, its employees, its subsidiaries, and its subsidiaries' employees with the requirements of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. These written policies and procedures must be appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of the mortgage lending activities of the depository institution and its subsidiaries.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-j-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “depository institution” has the meaning in section 1503(2) of the SAFE <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-5102" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 5102</ref>(2). For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-j" reftype="internal">(j)</ref>, “subsidiary” has the meaning in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-1813" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1813</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, the term “loan originator” means a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who, in expectation of direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain or for direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> or other monetary gain, performs any of the following activities: takes an application, offers, arranges, assists a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in obtaining or applying to obtain, negotiates, or otherwise obtains or makes an extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> for another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>; or through advertising or other means of communication represents to the public that such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> can or will perform any of these activities. The term “loan originator” includes an employee, agent, or contractor of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> if the employee, agent, or contractor meets this definition. The term “loan originator” includes a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> that engages in loan origination activities if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> does not finance the transaction at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> out of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s own resources, including by drawing on a bona fide warehouse line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> or out of deposits held by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>. All <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> that engage in any of the foregoing loan origination activities are loan originators for purposes of paragraphs <ref target="1026-36-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> and <ref target="1026-36-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> of this section. The term does not include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-A
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application or offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, but who performs purely administrative or clerical tasks on behalf of a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who does engage in such activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An employee of a manufactured home retailer who does not take a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> application, offer or negotiate <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, or advise a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> terms (including rates, fees, and other costs) available from a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> that performs only real estate brokerage activities and is licensed or registered in accordance with applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> law, unless such <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> is compensated by a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> or by any agent of such <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for a particular <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction subject to this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-D
paragraph.content: A seller financer that meets the criteria in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-a-4" reftype="internal">(a)(4)</ref> or <ref target="1026-36-a-5" reftype="internal">(a)(5)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-E
paragraph.content: A servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate terms for purposes of renegotiating, modifying, replacing, or subordinating principal of existing mortgages where <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> are behind in their payments, in default, or have a reasonable likelihood of defaulting or falling behind. This exception does not apply, however, to a servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate a transaction that constitutes a refinancing under § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref> or obligates a different <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the existing debt.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v-Interp-4-iii
interpParagraph.content: Assume that the subject property is located in an area where flood insurance is required by Federal law, and assume further that the flood insurance policy premium is paid every three years following consummation. The creditor complies with § 1026.43(c)(2)(v) by dividing the three-year premium by 36 months and including the resulting amount in the determination of the consumer's monthly payment for mortgage-related obligations. The creditor complies even if the consumer will not establish a monthly escrow for flood insurance.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-2" reftype="internal">(a)(2)</ref> of this section, the requirements of this section apply to a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction that is secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, and in which either:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-i
paragraph.content: The annual percentage rate at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> will exceed by more than 8 percentage points for first-lien loans, or by more than 10 percentage points for subordinate-lien loans, the yield on Treasury securities having comparable periods of maturity to the loan maturity as of the fifteenth day of the month immediately preceding the month in which the application for the extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> is received by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: The total points and fees payable by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before loan closing will exceed the greater of 8 percent of the total loan amount, or $400; the $400 figure shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Price Index that was reported on the preceding June 1.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2
paragraph.content: This section does not apply to the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-24" reftype="term">residential mortgage transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-ii
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-33-a" reftype="term">reverse mortgage transaction</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-33" reftype="internal">1026.33</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-a-2-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-2-a-20" reftype="term">open-end credit</ref> plan subject to subpart B of this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this subpart, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1
paragraph.content: In connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref><ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">d-end cred</ref>it transaction, points and fees means the following fees or charges that are known at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-ii
paragraph.content: All <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid directly or indirectly by a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> or <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1), that can be attributed to that transaction at the time the interest rate is set;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii
paragraph.content: All items listed in § <ref target="1026-4-c-7" reftype="internal">1026.4(c)(7)</ref> (other than amounts held for future payment of taxes), unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-A
paragraph.content: The charge is reasonable;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-B
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives no direct or indirect <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in connection with the charge; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iii-C
paragraph.content: The charge is not paid to an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-iv
paragraph.content: Premiums or other charges payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> for any <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> life, <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> disability, <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> unemployment, or <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> property insurance, or any other life, accident, health, or loss-of-income insurance for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a beneficiary, or any payments directly or indirectly for any debt cancellation or suspension agreement or contract;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-v
paragraph.content: The maximum prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, that may be charged or collected under the terms of the mortgage loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-vi
paragraph.content: The total prepayment penalty, as defined in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-6-i" reftype="internal">(b)(6)(i)</ref> of this section, incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> refinances the existing mortgage loan with the current holder of the existing loan, a servicer acting on behalf of the current holder, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-2
paragraph.content: [Reserved]<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3
paragraph.title: Bona fide discount point
paragraph.content: Bona fide discount point —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The term bona fide discount point means an amount equal to 1 percent of the loan amount paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that reduces the interest rate or time-price differential applicable to the transaction based on a calculation that is consistent with established industry practices for determining the amount of reduction in the interest rate or time-price differential appropriate for the amount of discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-3-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4
paragraph.title: Total loan amount
paragraph.content: Total loan amount —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref>. The total loan amount for a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction is calculated by taking the amount financed, as determined according to § <ref target="1026-18-b" reftype="internal">1026.18(b)</ref>, and deducting any cost listed in § <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)(iii)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-vi" reftype="internal">(vi)</ref> that is both included as points and fees under § <ref target="1026-32-b-1" reftype="internal">1026.32(b)(1)</ref> and financed by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-5
paragraph.content: Affiliate means any company that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with another company, as set forth in the Bank Holding Company <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1956 (<ref target="USC:12-1841" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1841</ref> et seq.).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalty
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty —

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-ii
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c
paragraph.title: Disclosures.
paragraph.content: Disclosures. In addition to other disclosures required by this part, in a mortgage subject to this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall disclose the following in conspicuous type size:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-1
paragraph.title: Notices.
paragraph.content: Notices. The following statement: “You are not required to complete this agreement merely because you have received these disclosures or have signed a loan application. If you obtain this loan, the lender will have a mortgage on your home. You could lose your home, and any money you have put into it, if you do not meet your obligations under the loan.”

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-2
paragraph.title: Annual percentage rate.
paragraph.content: Annual percentage rate. The annual percentage rate.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-3
paragraph.title: Regular payment; balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Regular payment; balloon payment. The amount of the regular monthly (or other periodic) payment and the amount of any balloon payment. The regular payment disclosed under this paragraph shall be treated as accurate if it is based on an amount borrowed that is deemed accurate and is disclosed under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-4
paragraph.title: Variable-rate.
paragraph.content: Variable-rate. For variable-rate transactions, a statement that the interest rate and monthly payment may increase, and the amount of the single maximum monthly payment, based on the maximum interest rate required to be disclosed under § <ref target="1026-30" reftype="internal">1026.30</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-c-5
paragraph.title: Amount borrowed.
paragraph.content: Amount borrowed. For a mortgage refinancing, the total amount the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will borrow, as reflected by the face amount of the note; and where the amount borrowed includes premiums or other charges for optional <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insurance or debt-cancellation coverage, that fact shall be stated, grouped together with the disclosure of the amount borrowed. The disclosure of the amount borrowed shall be treated as accurate if it is not more than $100 above or below the amount required to be disclosed.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d
paragraph.title: Limitations.
paragraph.content: Limitations. A mortgage transaction subject to this section shall not include the following terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Balloon payment.
paragraph.content: Balloon payment. For a loan with a term of less than five years, a payment schedule with regular periodic payments that when aggregated do not fully amortize the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exception.
paragraph.content: Exception. The limitations in paragraph <ref target="1026-32-d-1-i" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)</ref> of this section do not apply to loans with maturities of less than one year, if the purpose of the loan is a “bridge” loan connected with the acquisition or construction of a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> intended to become the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-2
paragraph.title: Negative amortization.
paragraph.content: Negative amortization. A payment schedule with regular periodic payments that cause the principal balance to increase.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-3
paragraph.title: Advance payments.
paragraph.content: Advance payments. A payment schedule that consolidates more than two periodic payments and pays them in advance from the proceeds.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-4
paragraph.title: Increased interest rate.
paragraph.content: Increased interest rate. An increase in the interest rate after default.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-5
paragraph.title: Rebates.
paragraph.content: Rebates. A refund calculated by a method less favorable than the actuarial method (as defined by section 933(d) of the Housing and Community Development <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992, <ref target="USC:15-1615" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1615</ref>(d)), for rebates of interest arising from a loan acceleration due to default.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-6
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalties. Except as allowed under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-d-7" reftype="internal">(d)(7)</ref> of this section, a penalty for paying all or part of the principal before the date on which the principal is due. A prepayment penalty includes computing a refund of unearned interest by a method that is less favorable to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> than the actuarial method, as defined by section 933(d) of the Housing and Community Development <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992, <ref target="USC:15-1615" reftype="external">15 U.S.C. 1615</ref>(d).

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalty exception.
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty exception. A mortgage transaction subject to this section may provide for a prepayment penalty (including a refund calculated according to the rule of 78s) otherwise permitted by law if, under the terms of the loan:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7-i
paragraph.content: The penalty will not apply after the two-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7-ii
paragraph.content: The penalty will not apply if the source of the prepayment funds is a refinancing by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7-iii
paragraph.content: At <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s total monthly debt payments (including amounts owed under the mortgage) do not exceed 50 percent of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly gross income, as verified in accordance with § <ref target="1026-34-a-4-ii" reftype="internal">1026.34(a)(4)(ii)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-7-iv
paragraph.content: The amount of the periodic payment of principal or interest or both may not change during the four-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8
paragraph.title: Due-on-demand clause.
paragraph.content: Due-on-demand clause. A demand feature that permits the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> to terminate the loan in advance of the original maturity date and to demand repayment of the entire outstanding balance, except in the following circumstances:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-i
paragraph.content: There is fraud or material misrepresentation by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> fails to meet the repayment terms of the agreement for any outstanding balance; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-d-8-iii
paragraph.content: There is any action or inaction by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> that adversely affects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s security for the loan, or any right of the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> in such security.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-8-Interp-5
interpParagraph.content: Relation to the finance charge. Section 1026.43(b)(8) includes in the evaluation of mortgage-related obligations premiums and similar charges identified in § 1026.4(b)(5), (7), (8), or (10) that are required by the creditor. These premiums and similar charges are mortgage-related obligations regardless of whether the premium or similar charge is excluded from the finance charge pursuant to § 1026.4(d). For example, a premium for insurance against loss or damage to the property written in connection with the credit transaction is a premium identified in § 1026.4(b)(8). If this premium is required by the creditor, the premium is a mortgage-related obligation pursuant to § 1026.43(b)(8), regardless of whether the premium is excluded from the finance charge pursuant to § 1026.4(d)(2).

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-6-b
paragraph.content: Example: A registered nurse may have worked 24 hours per week for the last year. Although this job is less than the 40-hour work week, it is the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s primary employment, and should be considered effective income.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: Fees imposed for preparing and providing documents when a loan is paid in full if such fees are imposed whether or not the loan is prepaid. Examples include a loan payoff statement, a reconveyance document, or another document releasing the creditor's security interest in the dwelling that secures the loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4
paragraph.title: Offer through a mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Offer through a mortgage broker. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> through a mortgage broker, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(2)</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-i
paragraph.content: Present the mortgage broker an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii
paragraph.content: Establish by agreement that the mortgage broker must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of discount points and origination points or fees.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Renewable balloon-payment mortgage; loan term. A balloon-payment mortgage that is not a higher-priced covered transaction could provide that a creditor is unconditionally obligated to renew a balloon-payment mortgage at the consumer's option (or is obligated to renew subject to conditions within the consumer's control). See comment 17(c)(1)-11 discussing renewable balloon-payment mortgages. For purposes of this section, the loan term does not include any period of time that could result from a renewal provision. To illustrate, assume a three-year balloon-payment mortgage that is not a higher-priced covered transaction contains an unconditional obligation to renew for another three years at the consumer's option. In this example, the loan term for the balloon-payment mortgage is three years, and not the potential six years that could result if the consumer chooses to renew the loan. Accordingly, the creditor must underwrite the loan using the maximum payment scheduled in the first five years after consummation, which includes the balloon payment due at the end of the three-year loan term. See comment 43(c)(5)(ii)(A)-4.ii, which provides an example of how to determine the consumer's repayment ability for a three-year renewable balloon-payment mortgage that is not a higher-priced covered transaction.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: First five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. Under § 1026.43(c)(5)(ii)(A)(1), the creditor must determine a consumer's ability to repay a loan with a balloon payment that is not a higher-priced covered transaction using the maximum payment scheduled during the first five years (60 months) after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. To illustrate:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-2-i
interpParagraph.content: Assume a loan that provides for regular monthly payments and a balloon payment due at the end of a six-year loan term. The loan is consummated on August 15, 2014, and the first monthly payment is due on October 1, 2014. The first five years after the first monthly payment end on October 1, 2019. The balloon payment must be made on the due date of the 72nd monthly payment, which is September 1, 2020. For purposes of determining the consumer's ability to repay the loan under § 1026.43(c)(2)(iii), the creditor need not consider the balloon payment that is due on September 1, 2020.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-2-ii
interpParagraph.content: Assume a loan that provides for regular monthly payments and a balloon payment due at the end of a five-year loan term. The loan is consummated on August 15, 2014, and the first monthly payment is due on October 1, 2014. The first five years after the first monthly payment end on October 1, 2019. The balloon payment must be made on the due date of the 60th monthly payment, which is September 1, 2019. For purposes of determining the consumer's ability to repay the loan under § 1026.43(c)(2)(iii), the creditor must consider the balloon payment that is due on September 1, 2019.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: General. For loans with a balloon payment, the rules differ depending on whether the loan is a higher-priced covered transaction, as defined under § 1026.43(b)(4), or is not a higher-priced covered transaction because the annual percentage rate does not exceed the applicable threshold calculated using the applicable average prime offer rate (APOR) for a comparable transaction. “Average prime offer rate” is defined in § 1026.35(a)(2); “higher-priced covered transaction” is defined in § 1026.43(b)(4). For higher-priced covered transactions with a balloon payment, the creditor must consider the consumer's ability to repay the loan based on the payment schedule under the terms of the legal obligation, including any required balloon payment. For loans with a balloon payment that are not higher-priced covered transactions, the creditor should use the maximum payment scheduled during the first five years of the loan following the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. “Balloon payment” is defined in § 1026.18(s)(5)(i).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b
paragraph.title: Rules affecting young consumers
paragraph.content: Rules affecting young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>—

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1
paragraph.title: Applications from young consumers.
paragraph.content: Applications from young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> may not open a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account under an open-end (not home-secured) <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> plan for a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> less than 21 years old, unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has submitted a written application and the <ref target="1026-2-a-7" reftype="term">card issuer</ref> has:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-i
paragraph.content: Financial information indicating the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has an independent ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on the proposed extension of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> in connection with the account; or<ref target="1026-51-a" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A signed agreement of a cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant who is at least 21 years old to be either secondarily liable for any debt on the account incurred by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has attained the age of 21 or jointly liable with the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for any debt on the account; and

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Financial information indicating such cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant has the ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on such debts, consistent with paragraph (a) of this <ref target="1026-51-a" reftype="internal">sec</ref>tion.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2
paragraph.title: Credit line increases for young consumers.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">Credit</ref> line increases for young <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>. <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal"></ref>

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account has been opened pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section, no increase in the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit may be made on such account before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> attains the age of 21 unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: At the time of the contemplated increase, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has an independent ability to make the required minimum periodic payments on the increased limit consistent with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-i" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)</ref> of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A cosigner, guarantor, or joint applicant who is at least 21 years old agrees in writing to assume liability for any debt incurred on the account, consistent with paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-51-b-2-ii
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-2-a-15-i" reftype="term">credit card</ref> account has been opened pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-51-b-1-ii" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, no increase in the <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> limit may be made on such account before the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> attains the age of 21 unless the cosigner, guarantor, or joint accountholder who assumed liability at account opening agrees in writing to assume liability on the increase.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-Interp-5
interpParagraph.content: Higher-priced covered transaction with a balloon payment. Where a loan with a balloon payment is a higher-priced covered transaction, the creditor must determine the consumer's repayment ability based on the loan's payment schedule, including any balloon payment. For example (all amounts are rounded): Assume a higher-priced covered transaction with a fixed interest rate of 7 percent. The loan amount is $200,000 and the loan has a ten year loan term, but is amortized over 30 years. The monthly payment scheduled for the first ten years is $1,331, with a balloon payment of $172,955. For purposes of § 1026.43(c)(2)(iii), the creditor must consider the consumer's ability to repay the loan based on the payment schedule that fully repays the loan amount, including the balloon payment of $172,955.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Eligible loans.
paragraph.content: Eligible loans. A qualified mortgage under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref> must be one of the following at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation operating under the conservatorship or receivership of the Federal Housing Finance Agency pursuant to section 1367(a) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(a)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by any limited-life regulatory entity succeeding the charter of either the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation pursuant to section 1367(i) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> of 1992 (<ref target="USC:12-4617" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 4617</ref>(i));

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development under the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1707" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1707</ref> et seq.);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-D
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed by the U.S. Department of Agriculture pursuant to <ref target="USC:42-1472" reftype="external">42 U.S.C. 1472</ref>(h); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-E
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the Rural Housing Service.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-6-a-ii
paragraph.content: General economic outlook for similar businesses in the area.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Satisfaction of qualified mortgage requirements. Under § 1026.43(f)(1)(i), for a mortgage that provides for a balloon payment to be a qualified mortgage, the mortgage must satisfy the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs (e)(2)(i)(A), (e)(2)(ii), (iii), and (v). Therefore, a covered transaction with balloon payment terms must provide for regular periodic payments that do not result in an increase of the principal balance, pursuant to § 1026.43(e)(2)(i)(A); must have a loan term that does not exceed 30 years, pursuant to § 1026.43(e)(2)(ii); must have total points and fees that do not exceed specified thresholds pursuant to § 1026.43(e)(2)(iii); and must satisfy the consideration and verification requirements in § 1026.43(e)(2)(v).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Example. Under § 1026.43(f)(1)(ii), if a qualified mortgage provides for a balloon payment, the creditor must determine that the consumer is able to make all scheduled payments under the legal obligation other than the balloon payment. For example, assume a loan in an amount of $200,000 that has a five-year loan term, but is amortized over 30 years. The loan agreement provides for a fixed interest rate of 6 percent. The loan consummates on March 3, 2014, and the monthly payment of principal and interest scheduled for the first five years is $1,199, with the first monthly payment due on April 1, 2014. The balloon payment of $187,308 is required on the due date of the 60th monthly payment, which is April 1, 2019. The loan can be a qualified mortgage if the creditor underwrites the loan using the scheduled principal and interest payment of $1,199, plus the consumer's monthly payment for all mortgage-related obligations, and satisfies the other criteria set forth in § 1026.43(f).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Creditor's determination. A creditor must determine that the consumer is able to make all scheduled payments other than the balloon payment to satisfy § 1026.43(f)(1)(ii), in accordance with the legal obligation, together with the consumer's monthly payments for all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment, to meet the repayment ability requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(ii). A creditor satisfies § 1026.43(f)(1)(ii) if it uses the maximum payment in the payment schedule, excluding any balloon payment, to determine if the consumer has the ability to make the scheduled payments.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Debt-to-income or residual income. A creditor must consider and verify the consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income to meet the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(iii). To calculate the consumer's monthly debt-to-income or residual income for purposes of § 1026.43(f)(1)(iii), the creditor may rely on the definitions and calculation rules in § 1026.43(c)(7) and its accompanying commentary, except for the calculation rules for a consumer's total monthly debt obligations (which is a component of debt-to-income and residual income under § 1026.43(c)(7)). For purposes of calculating the consumer's total monthly debt obligations under § 1026.43(f)(1)(iii), the creditor must calculate the monthly payment on the covered transaction using the payment calculation rules in § 1026.43(f)(1)(iv)(A), together with all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Scheduled payments. Under § 1026.43(f)(1)(iv)(A), the legal obligation must provide that scheduled payments must be substantially equal and determined using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years. Balloon payments often result when the periodic payment would fully repay the loan amount only if made over some period that is longer than the loan term. For example, a loan term of 10 years with periodic payments based on an amortization period of 20 years would result in a balloon payment being due at the end of the loan term. Whatever the loan term, the amortization period used to determine the scheduled periodic payments that the consumer must pay under the terms of the legal obligation may not exceed 30 years.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Substantially equal. The calculation of payments scheduled by the legal obligation under § 1026.43(f)(1)(iv)(A) are required to result in substantially equal amounts. This means that the scheduled payments need to be similar, but need not be equal. For further guidance on substantially equal payments, see comment 43(c)(5)(i)-4.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Interest-only payments. A mortgage that only requires the payment of accrued interest each month does not meet the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(iv)(A).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Forward commitments. A creditor may make a mortgage loan that will be transferred or sold to a purchaser pursuant to an agreement that has been entered into at or before the time the transaction is consummated. Such an agreement is sometimes known as a “forward commitment.” A balloon-payment mortgage that will be acquired by a purchaser pursuant to a forward commitment does not satisfy the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(v), whether the forward commitment provides for the purchase and sale of the specific transaction or for the purchase and sale of transactions with certain prescribed criteria that the transaction meets. However, a purchase and sale of a balloon-payment qualified mortgage to another person that separately meets the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(vi) is permitted. For example: assume a creditor that meets the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(vi) makes a balloon-payment mortgage that meets the requirements of § 1026.43(f)(1)(i) through (iv); if the balloon-payment mortgage meets the purchase criteria of an investor with which the creditor has an agreement to sell such loans after consummation, then the balloon-payment mortgage does not meet the definition of a qualified mortgage in accordance with § 1026.43(f)(1)(v). However, if the investor meets the requirement of § 1026.43(f)(1)(vi), the balloon-payment qualified mortgage retains its qualified mortgage status.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Creditor qualifications. Under § 1026.43(f)(1)(vi), to make a qualified mortgage that provides for a balloon payment, the creditor must satisfy three criteria that are also required under § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A), (B) and (C), which require:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the creditor extended over 50 percent of its total first-lien covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), on properties that are located in counties that are designated either “rural” or “underserved,” as defined in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iv), to satisfy the requirement of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A). Pursuant to § 1026.35(b)(2)(iv), a county is considered to be rural if it is neither in a metropolitan statistical area, nor a micropolitan statistical area adjacent to a metropolitan statistical area, as those terms are defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget. A county is considered to be underserved if no more than two creditors extend covered transactions secured by a first lien five or more times in that county during a calendar year. The Bureau determines annually which counties in the United States are rural or underserved and publishes on its public Web site lists of those counties to enable creditors to determine whether they meet this criterion. Thus, for example, if a creditor originated 90 first-lien covered transactions during 2013, the creditor meets this element of the exception in 2014 if at least 46 of those transactions are secured by first liens on properties located in one or more counties that are on the Bureau's lists for 2013.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: During the preceding calendar year, the creditor together with its affiliates originated 500 or fewer first-lien covered transactions, as defined by § 1026.43(b)(1), to satisfy the requirement of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(B).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: As of the end of the preceding calendar year, the creditor had total assets that do not exceed the current asset threshold established by the Bureau, to satisfy the requirement of § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(C). For calendar year 2013, the asset threshold was $2,000,000,000.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Total loan amount; examples. Below are several examples showing how to calculate the total loan amount for closed-end mortgage loans, each using a $10,000 amount borrowed, a $300 appraisal fee, and $400 in prepaid finance charges. A $500 single premium for optional credit unemployment insurance is used in one example.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for a creditor-conducted appraisal and pays $400 in prepaid finance charges at closing, the amount financed under § 1026.18(b) is $9,900 ($10,000 plus the $300 appraisal fee that is paid to and financed by the creditor, less $400 in prepaid finance charges). The $300 appraisal fee paid to the creditor is added to other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(iii). It is deducted from the amount financed ($9,900) to derive a total loan amount of $9,600.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer pays the $300 fee for the creditor-conducted appraisal in cash at closing, the $300 is included in the points and fees calculation because it is paid to the creditor. However, because the $300 is not financed by the creditor, the fee is not part of the amount financed under § 1026.18(b). In this case, the amount financed is the same as the total loan amount: $9,600 ($10,000, less $400 in prepaid finance charges).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for an appraisal conducted by someone other than the creditor or an affiliate, the $300 fee is not included with other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(iii). In this case, the amount financed is the same as the total loan amount: $9,900 ($10,000 plus the $300 fee for an independently-conducted appraisal that is financed by the creditor, less the $400 paid in cash and deducted as prepaid finance charges).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-iv
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for a creditor-conducted appraisal and a $500 single premium for optional credit unemployment insurance, and pays $400 in prepaid finance charges at closing, the amount financed under § 1026.18(b) is $10,400 ($10,000, plus the $300 appraisal fee that is paid to and financed by the creditor, plus the $500 insurance premium that is financed by the creditor, less $400 in prepaid finance charges). The $300 appraisal fee paid to the creditor is added to other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(ii), and the $500 insurance premium is added under 1026.32(b)(1)(iv). The $300 and $500 costs are deducted from the amount financed ($10,400) to derive a total loan amount of $9,600.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-Interp-10-iii
interpParagraph.content: On March 15, 2015, the creditor receives the consumer's written application for a refinancing, after the consumer has made 12 monthly on-time payments. On this date, the index value is 4.5 percent.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Regular periodic payments. Under § 1026.43(e)(2)(i), a qualified mortgage must provide for regular periodic payments that may not result in an increase of the principal balance (negative amortization), deferral of principal repayment, or a balloon payment. Thus, the terms of the legal obligation must require the consumer to make payments of principal and interest, on a monthly or other periodic basis, that will fully repay the loan amount over the loan term. The periodic payments must be substantially equal except for the effect that any interest rate change after consummation has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage. In addition, because § 1026.43(e)(2)(i) requires that a qualified mortgage provide for regular periodic payments, a single-payment transaction may not be a qualified mortgage.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Deferral of principal repayment. Under § 1026.43(e)(2)(i)(B), a qualified mortgage's regular periodic payments may not allow the consumer to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in § 1026.43(f). A loan allows the deferral of principal repayment if one or more of the periodic payments may be applied solely to accrued interest and not to loan principal. Deferred principal repayment also occurs if the payment is applied to both accrued interest and principal but the consumer is permitted to make periodic payments that are less than the amount that would be required under a payment schedule that has substantially equal payments that fully repay the loan amount over the loan term. Graduated payment mortgages, for example, allow deferral of principal repayment in this manner and therefore may not be qualified mortgages.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-12
paragraph.content: Simultaneous loan means another <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref> that will be secured by the same <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> and made to the same <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> or, if to be made after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, will cover closing costs of the first <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1
paragraph.content: “Higher-priced mortgage loan” means a closed-end <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref><ref target="1026-35-b-3-v" reftype="internal">it transa</ref>ction secured by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s principal <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref> with an annual percentage rate that exceeds the <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="term">average prime offer rate</ref> for a comparable transaction as of the date the interest rate is set:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-i
paragraph.content: By 1.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that does not exceed the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: By 2.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a first lien with a principal obligation at <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that exceeds the limit in effect as of the date the transaction's interest rate is set for the maximum principal obligation eligible for purchase by Freddie Mac; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-a-1-iii
paragraph.content: By 3.5 or more percentage points for loans secured by a subordinate lien.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-1
paragraph.title: Description: “S” Corporation.
paragraph.content: Description: “S” Corporation.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-1-a
paragraph.content: An “S” corporation is generally a small, start-up business, with gains and losses passed to stockholders in proportion to each stockholder's percentage of business ownership.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-1-b
paragraph.content: Income for owners of “S” corporations comes from IRS Form W-2 wages, and is taxed at the individual rate. The IRS Form 1120S, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> of Officers line item is transferred to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s individual IRS Form 1040.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-2
paragraph.title: Analyzing “S” Corporation Tax Returns.
paragraph.content: Analyzing “S” Corporation Tax Returns.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-2-a
paragraph.content: “S” corporation depreciation and depletion may be added back to income in proportion to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s share of the corporation's income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-2-b
paragraph.content: In addition, the income must also be reduced proportionately by the total obligations payable by the corporation in less than one year.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-G-2-c
paragraph.content: Important: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s withdrawal of cash from the corporation may have a severe negative impact on the corporation's ability to continue operating, and must be considered in the income analysis.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3-ii
interpParagraph.content: Fixed-rate, graduated payment mortgage with negative amortization. A loan in the amount of $200,000 has a 30-year loan term. The loan agreement provides for a fixed interest rate of 7.5 percent, and requires the consumer to make minimum monthly payments during the first year, with payments increasing 12.5 percent over the previous year every year for four years. The payment schedule provides for payments of $943 in the first year, $1,061 in the second year, $1,193 in the third year, $1,343 in the fourth year, and $1,511 for the remaining term of the loan. During the first three years of the loan, the payments are less than the interest accrued each month, resulting in negative amortization. Assuming that the consumer makes the minimum periodic payments for as long as possible, the maximum loan amount is $207,662, which is reached at the end of the third year of the loan (on the due date of the 36th monthly payment). See comment 43(c)(5)(ii)(C)-3 providing examples of how to determine the consumer's repayment ability for a negative amortization loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2
paragraph.title: Analyzing Partnership Tax Returns.
paragraph.content: Analyzing Partnership Tax Returns.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-a
paragraph.content: Both general and limited partnerships report income on IRS Form 1065, and the partners' share of income is carried over to Schedule E of IRS Form 1040.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-b
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must review IRS Form 1065 to assess the viability of the business. Both depreciation and depletion may be added back to the income in proportion to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s share of income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-c
paragraph.content: Income must also be reduced proportionately by the total obligations payable by the partnership in less than one year.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-d
paragraph.content: Important: Cash withdrawals from the partnership may have a severe negative impact on the partnership's ability to continue operating, and must be considered in the income analysis.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Electronic records. Third-party records include records transmitted electronically. For example, to verify a consumer's credit history using third-party records as required by § 1026.43(c)(2)(viii) and 1026.43(c)(3), a creditor may use a credit report prepared by a consumer reporting agency that is transmitted electronically.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Forms. A record prepared by a third party includes a form a creditor gives to a third party to provide information, even if the creditor completes parts of the form unrelated to the information sought. For example, if a creditor gives a consumer's employer a form for verifying the consumer's employment status and income, the creditor may fill in the creditor's name and other portions of the form unrelated to the consumer's employment status or income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1
paragraph.title: Description: Partnership.
paragraph.content: Description: Partnership.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1-a
paragraph.content: A partnership is formed when two or more individuals form a business, and share in profits, losses, and responsibility for running the company.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1-b
paragraph.content: Each partner pays taxes on his/her proportionate share of the partnership's net income.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d
paragraph.title: Prohibited payments to loan originators
paragraph.content: Prohibited payments to <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originators</ref> —

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1
paragraph.title: Payments based on transaction terms or conditions.
paragraph.content: Payments based on a term of a transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-i
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (d)(1)(iii) or (iv) of this section, in connection with a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, no <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive and no <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> shall pay to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in an amount that is based on a term of a transaction, the terms of multiple transactions by an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, or the terms of multiple transactions by multiple <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originators</ref>. If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based in whole or in part on a factor that is a proxy for a term of a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> is based on a term of a transaction. A factor that is not itself a term of a transaction is a proxy for a term of the transaction if the factor consistently varies with that term over a significant number of transactions, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> has the ability, directly or indirectly, to add, drop, or change the factor in originating the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> only, a “term of a transaction” is any right or obligation of the parties to a <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> transaction. The amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended is not a term of a transaction or a proxy for a term of a transaction, provided that <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> received by or paid to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, is based on a fixed percentage of the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> extended; however, such <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> may be subject to a minimum or maximum dollar amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iii
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">oan or</ref>iginator may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref><ref target="1026-36-d-2" reftype="internal">dual l</ref>oan originator, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> in the form of a contribution to a defined contribution plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan or a benefit under a defined benefit plan that is a designated tax-advantaged plan. In the case of a contribution to a defined contribution plan, the contribution shall not be directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions. As used in this paragraph (d)(1)(iii), “designated tax-advantaged plan” means any plan that meets the requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a), 26 U.S.C. 401(a); employee annuity plan described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(a), 26 U.S.C. 403(a); simple retirement account, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 408(p), 26 U.S.C. 408(p); simplified employee pension described in Internal Revenue Code section 408(k), 26 U.S.C. 408(k); annuity contract described in Internal Revenue Code section 403(b), 26 U.S.C. 403(b); or eligible deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan, as defined in Internal Revenue Code section 457(b), 26 U.S.C. 457(b).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv
paragraph.content: An <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive, and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> may pay to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under a non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan (i.e., any arrangement for the payment of non-deferred <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> that is determined with reference to the profits of the <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> from mortgage-related business), provided that:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: At least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> does not, in the aggregate, exceed 10 percent of the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s total <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> corresponding to the time period for which the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> under the non-deferred profits-based <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> plan is paid; or

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> was a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> for ten or fewer transactions subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> consummated during the 12-month period preceding the date of the <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> determination.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2
paragraph.title: Payments by persons other than consumer.
paragraph.content: Payments by <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">persons</ref> other than <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i
paragraph.content: Dual <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-2-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, if any <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in a <ref target="1026-2-a-12" reftype="term">consumer credit</ref> transaction secured by a <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-1
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> shall receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>, directly or indirectly, from any <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction; and

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-A-2
paragraph.content: No <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> who knows or has reason to know of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>-paid <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> (other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>) shall pay any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, directly or indirectly, in connection with the transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-B
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">Compensation</ref> received directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> includes payments to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> made pursuant to an agreement between the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> and a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> other than the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> or its <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref>, under which such other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> agrees to provide funds toward the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s costs of the transaction (including <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref>).

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-i-C
paragraph.content: If a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> receives <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with a transaction, the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref> may pay <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> may receive <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> from the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-iii" reftype="term">loan originator organization</ref>, subject to paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1" reftype="internal">(d)(1)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: Exemption. A payment to a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> that is otherwise prohibited by section 129B(c)(2)(A) of the Truth in Lending <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> is nevertheless permitted pursuant to section 129B(c)(2)(B) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, regardless of whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> makes any upfront payment of discount points, origination points, or fees, as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, as long as the <ref target="1026-36-a-1-i" reftype="term">loan originator</ref> does not receive any <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> directly from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> as described in section 129B(c)(2)(B)(i) of the <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-3
paragraph.title: Affiliates.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">Affiliates</ref>. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliates</ref> shall be treated as a single “<ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>.”

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v-Interp-5-iii
interpParagraph.content: Assume that the homeowners association imposes a special assessment after the creditor has completed underwriting, but prior to consummation. The creditor does not violate § 1026.43(c)(2)(v) if the creditor does not include the special assessment in the determination of the consumer's monthly payment for mortgage-related obligations, provided the homeowners association does not inform the creditor about the special assessment during underwriting. Section 1026.43(c)(2)(v) does not require the creditor to re-underwrite the loan. The creditor has complied with § 1026.43(c)(2)(v) by including the obligations known to the creditor at the time the loan is underwritten, even if the creditor learns of new mortgage-related obligations before the transaction is consummated.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-1-p4
paragraph.content: ```note Notes: i. Effective income for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> planning to retire during the first three-year period must include the amount of: a. Documented retirement benefits; b. Social Security payments; or c. Other payments expected to be received in retirement. ii. <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditors</ref> must not ask the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> about possible, future maternity leave. ```

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Adjustable-rate mortgage with an introductory fixed rate.
