For purposes of making the evaluation required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iv" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iv)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider, taking into account any <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s payment on a <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, by following paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref>of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-ii
paragraph.content: A home equity line of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> subject to § <ref target="1026-40" reftype="internal">1026.40</ref>, by using the periodic payment required under the terms of the plan and the amount of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> to be drawn at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> of the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculation
paragraph.content: Payment calculation —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. Except as provided in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(5)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-B
paragraph.content: Monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> that are substantially equal.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must make the consideration required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-iii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4
paragraph.title: Verification of income or assets.
paragraph.content: Verification of income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the amounts of income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)(i)</ref> to determine a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s ability to repay a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref> that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income using a tax-return transcript issued by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Examples of other records the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may use to verify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets include:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-i
paragraph.content: Copies of tax returns the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> filed with the IRS or a <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-ii
paragraph.content: IRS Form W-2s or similar IRS forms used for reporting wages or tax withholding;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iii
paragraph.content: Payroll statements, including military Leave and Earnings Statements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iv
paragraph.content: Financial institution records;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-v
paragraph.content: Records from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employer or a third party that obtained information from the employer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vi
paragraph.content: Records from a Federal, <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref>, or local government agency stating the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income from benefits or entitlements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of check cashing services; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-viii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s use of a funds transfer service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3
paragraph.title: Verification using third-party records.
paragraph.content: Verification using <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify the information that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in determining a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s repayment ability under § <ref target="1026-43-c-2" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(2)</ref> using reasonably reliable <ref target="1026-43-b-13" reftype="term">third-party records</ref>, except that:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-i" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(i)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income or assets that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on in accordance with § <ref target="1026-43-c-4" reftype="internal">1026.43(c)(4)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-ii" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment status orally if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> prepares a record of the information obtained orally; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-iii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-2-vi" reftype="internal">(c)(2)(vi)</ref> of this section, if a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report to verify a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations and a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s application <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">states</ref> a current debt obligation not shown in the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> need not independently verify such an obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2
paragraph.title: Basis for determination.
paragraph.content: Basis for determination. Except as provided otherwise in paragraphs <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref>, and <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section, in making the repayment ability determination required under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-1" reftype="internal">(c)(1)</ref> of this section, a <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must consider the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> relies on income from the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s employment in determining repayment ability, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-5" reftype="internal">(c)(5)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment on any <ref target="1026-43-b-12" reftype="term">simultaneous loan</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> knows or has reason to know will be made, calculated in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-6" reftype="internal">(c)(6)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for <ref target="1026-43-b-8" reftype="term">mortgage-related obligations</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current debt obligations, alimony, and child support;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c-7" reftype="internal">(c)(7)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> history.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-1
paragraph.title: General requirement.
paragraph.content: General requirement. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> shall not make a loan that is a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> makes a reasonable and good faith determination at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> will have a reasonable ability to repay the loan according to its terms.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-13-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Reviewed record. Under § 1026.43(b)(13)(i), a third-party record includes a document or other record prepared by the consumer, the creditor, the mortgage broker, or the creditor's or mortgage broker's agent, if the record is reviewed by an appropriate third party. For example, a profit-and-loss statement prepared by a self-employed consumer and reviewed by a third-party accountant is a third-party record under § 1026.43(b)(13)(i). In contrast, a profit-and-loss statement prepared by a self-employed consumer and reviewed by the consumer's non-accountant spouse is not a third-party record under § 1026.43(b)(13)(i).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. The term standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Cause the principal balance to increase;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-3
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the transaction do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: For which the term does not exceed 40 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-D
paragraph.content: For which the interest rate is fixed for at least the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E
paragraph.content: For which the proceeds from the loan are used solely for the following purposes:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-1
paragraph.content: To pay off the outstanding principal balance on the non-standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-2
paragraph.content: To pay closing or settlement charges required to be disclosed under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-5" reftype="internal">(d)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-4-d
paragraph.content: Business <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> report for corporations and “S” corporations.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-4-c
paragraph.content: Year to date profit and loss (P&L) statement and balance sheet; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-4-b
paragraph.content: For a corporation, “S” corporation, or partnership, signed copies of Federal business income tax returns for the last two years, with all applicable tax schedules;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-4-a
paragraph.content: Signed, dated individual tax returns, with all applicable tax schedules for the most recent two years;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d
paragraph.content: The assistance payment must be:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-i
paragraph.content: Paid directly to the servicing <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-ii
paragraph.content: Placed in an account that only the servicing <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> may access.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-d-p17
paragraph.content: ```note Note:Assistance payments made directly to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must be treated as income. ```

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Example. Under § 1026.43(f)(1)(ii), if a qualified mortgage provides for a balloon payment, the creditor must determine that the consumer is able to make all scheduled payments under the legal obligation other than the balloon payment. For example, assume a loan in an amount of $200,000 that has a five-year loan term, but is amortized over 30 years. The loan agreement provides for a fixed interest rate of 6 percent. The loan consummates on March 3, 2014, and the monthly payment of principal and interest scheduled for the first five years is $1,199, with the first monthly payment due on April 1, 2014. The balloon payment of $187,308 is required on the due date of the 60th monthly payment, which is April 1, 2019. The loan can be a qualified mortgage if the creditor underwrites the loan using the scheduled principal and interest payment of $1,199, plus the consumer's monthly payment for all mortgage-related obligations, and satisfies the other criteria set forth in § 1026.43(f).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-Interp-4
interpParagraph.content: First five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. Under § 1026.43(e)(2)(iv)(A), the creditor must underwrite the loan using the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. To illustrate, assume an adjustable-rate mortgage with an initial fixed interest rate of 5 percent for the first five years, measured from the first day of the first full calendar month following consummation, after which the interest rate will adjust annually to the specified index plus a margin of 6 percent, subject to a 2 percent annual interest rate adjustment cap. The index value in effect at consummation is 5.5 percent. The loan consummates on September 15, 2014, and the first monthly payment is due on November 1, 2014. The first rate adjustment to no more than 7 percent (5 percent plus 2 percent annual interest rate adjustment cap) occurs on the due date of the 60th monthly payment, which is October 1, 2019, and therefore, the rate adjustment occurs during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due. To meet the definition of qualified mortgage under § 1026.43(e)(2), the creditor must underwrite the loan using a monthly payment of principal and interest based on an interest rate of 7 percent.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, including any real property attached to the <ref target="1026-2-a-19" reftype="term">dwelling</ref>, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3
paragraph.title: Alternative offer required.
paragraph.content: Alternative offer required. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must not offer a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> also offers the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and the alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref> and has the same type of interest rate as the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; for purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref>, the term “type of interest rate” refers to whether a transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iii)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-ii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-ii
paragraph.content: Has the same <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> as the <ref target="1026-43-b-6" reftype="term">loan term</ref> for the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iii
paragraph.content: Satisfies the periodic payment conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-i" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(i)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iv
paragraph.content: Satisfies the <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> conditions under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2-iii" reftype="internal">(e)(2)(iii)</ref> of this section, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the transaction is offered; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-v
paragraph.content: Is a transaction for which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has a good faith belief that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> likely qualifies, based on the information known to the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> at the time the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2
paragraph.title: Limits on prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Limits on <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalties</ref>. A <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: Must not exceed the following percentages of the amount of the outstanding loan balance prepaid:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: 2 percent, if incurred during the first two years following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: 1 percent, if incurred during the third year following <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1
paragraph.title: When permitted.
paragraph.content: When permitted. A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> must not include a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> is otherwise permitted by law; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Calculation of maximum loan amount. For purposes of § 1026.43(c)(2)(iii) and (c)(5)(ii)(C), a creditor must determine the maximum loan amount for a negative amortization loan by using the loan amount plus any increase in principal balance that can result from negative amortization based on the terms of the legal obligation. In determining the maximum loan amount, a creditor must assume that the consumer makes the minimum periodic payment permitted under the loan agreement for as long as possible, until the consumer must begin making fully amortizing payments; and that the interest rate rises as quickly as possible after consummation under the terms of the legal obligation. Thus, creditors must assume that the consumer makes the minimum periodic payment until any negative amortization cap is reached or until the period permitting minimum periodic payments expires, whichever occurs first. “Loan amount” is defined in § 1026.43(b)(5); “negative amortization loan” is defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(v).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-2
interpParagraph.content: Assumed interest rate. In calculating the maximum loan amount for an adjustable-rate mortgage that is a negative amortization loan, the creditor must assume that the interest rate will increase as rapidly as possible after consummation, taking into account any periodic interest rate adjustment caps provided in the loan agreement. For an adjustable-rate mortgage with a lifetime maximum interest rate but no periodic interest rate adjustment cap, the creditor must assume that the interest rate increases to the maximum lifetime interest rate at the first adjustment.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3
interpParagraph.content: Examples. The following are examples of how to determine the maximum loan amount for a negative amortization loan (all amounts shown are rounded, and all amounts are calculated using non-rounded values):

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3-i
interpParagraph.content: Adjustable-rate mortgage with negative amortization.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3-i-A
interpParagraph.content: Assume an adjustable-rate mortgage in the amount of $200,000 with a 30-year loan term. The loan agreement provides that the consumer can make minimum monthly payments that cover only part of the interest accrued each month until the principal balance reaches 115 percent of its original balance (i.e., a negative amortization cap of 115 percent) or for the first five years of the loan (60 monthly payments), whichever occurs first. The introductory interest rate at consummation is 1.5 percent. One month after the first day of the first full calendar month following consummation, the interest rate adjusts and will adjust monthly thereafter based on the specified index plus a margin of 3.5 percent. The maximum lifetime interest rate is 10.5 percent; there are no other periodic interest rate adjustment caps that limit how quickly the maximum lifetime rate may be reached. The minimum monthly payment for the first year is based on the initial interest rate of 1.5 percent. After that, the minimum monthly payment adjusts annually, but may increase by no more than 7.5 percent over the previous year's payment. The minimum monthly payment is $690 in the first year, $742 in the second year, and $797 in the first part of the third year.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3-i-B
interpParagraph.content: To determine the maximum loan amount, assume that the initial interest rate increases to the maximum lifetime interest rate of 10.5 percent at the first adjustment (i.e., the due date of the first periodic monthly payment) and accrues at that rate until the loan is recast. Assume the consumer makes the minimum monthly payments as scheduled, which are capped at 7.5 percent from year-to-year. As a result, the consumer's minimum monthly payments are less than the interest accrued each month, resulting in negative amortization (i.e., the accrued but unpaid interest is added to the principal balance). Thus, assuming that the consumer makes the minimum monthly payments for as long as possible and that the maximum interest rate of 10.5 percent is reached at the first rate adjustment (i.e., the due date of the first periodic monthly payment), the negative amortization cap of 115 percent is reached on the due date of the 27th monthly payment and the loan is recast. The maximum loan amount as of the due date of the 27th monthly payment is $229,251.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-b-7-Interp-3-ii
interpParagraph.content: Fixed-rate, graduated payment mortgage with negative amortization. A loan in the amount of $200,000 has a 30-year loan term. The loan agreement provides for a fixed interest rate of 7.5 percent, and requires the consumer to make minimum monthly payments during the first year, with payments increasing 12.5 percent over the previous year every year for four years. The payment schedule provides for payments of $943 in the first year, $1,061 in the second year, $1,193 in the third year, $1,343 in the fourth year, and $1,511 for the remaining term of the loan. During the first three years of the loan, the payments are less than the interest accrued each month, resulting in negative amortization. Assuming that the consumer makes the minimum periodic payments for as long as possible, the maximum loan amount is $207,662, which is reached at the end of the third year of the loan (on the due date of the 36th monthly payment). See comment 43(c)(5)(ii)(C)-3 providing examples of how to determine the consumer's repayment ability for a negative amortization loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g" reftype="internal">(g)</ref> applies only if a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated with a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> is consummated without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> and <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> do not consummate a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5
paragraph.title: Creditor that is a loan originator.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditor</ref> that is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>. If the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is a <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, as defined in § <ref target="1026-36-a-1" reftype="internal">1026.36(a)(1)</ref>, and the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> presents the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> offered by a <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> to which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> would assign the <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must present the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> an alternative <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> without a <ref target="1026-43-b-10" reftype="term">prepayment penalty</ref> that satisfies the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-g-3" reftype="internal">(g)(3)</ref> of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref>, if the transaction offered by the other <ref target="1026-2-a-22" reftype="term">person</ref> has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-c
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditors</ref> may treat this subsidy as an “offset” to the monthly mortgage payment (that is, reduce the monthly mortgage payment by the amount of the home ownership assistance payment before dividing by the monthly income to determine the payment-to-income and debt-to-income ratios). The subsidy payment must not pass through the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s hands.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-2-d
paragraph.content: Partnerships.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-Interp-8-i
interpParagraph.content: First, the calculation must be based on the maximum loan amount, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance. If the consumer makes only the minimum periodic payments for the maximum possible time, until the consumer must begin making fully amortizing payments, the outstanding principal balance will be the maximum loan amount, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(7). In this event, the creditor complies with § 1026.43(d)(5)(i)(C)(3) by relying on the examples of how to calculate the maximum loan amount, see comment 43(b)(7)-3. If the consumer makes payments above the minimum periodic payments for the maximum possible time, the creditor must calculate the maximum loan amount based on the outstanding principal balance. In this event, the creditor complies with § 1026.43(d)(5)(i)(C)(3) by relying on the examples of how to calculate the maximum loan amount in comment 43(d)(5)(i)-10.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-2-a
paragraph.content: Sole proprietorships;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11
paragraph.content: Recast means:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-i
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which payments based on the introductory fixed interest rate are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-ii
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which interest-only payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-11-iii
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, the expiration of the period during which negatively amortizing payments are permitted under the terms of the legal obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-B-2-b-iii
paragraph.content: Duration of payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-2-b
paragraph.content: Corporations;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-A-3-ii
paragraph.content: Deposit slips;

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-C-5-a
paragraph.content: A monthly subsidy may be treated as income, if a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is receiving subsidies under the housing choice voucher home ownership option from a public housing agency (PHA). Although continuation of the homeownership voucher subsidy beyond the first year is subject to Congressional appropriation, for the purposes of underwriting, the subsidy will be assumed to continue for at least three years.

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iii)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for an appraisal conducted by someone other than the creditor or an affiliate, the $300 fee is not included with other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(iii). In this case, the amount financed is the same as the total loan amount: $9,900 ($10,000 plus the $300 fee for an independently-conducted appraisal that is financed by the creditor, less the $400 paid in cash and deducted as prepaid finance charges).

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h2-A-3-iv
paragraph.content: Court records.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d
paragraph.title: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages
paragraph.content: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(i)</ref>, with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. The term standard mortgage means a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Cause the principal balance to increase;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: Allow the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> to defer repayment of principal; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-3
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: For which the total <ref target="1026-43-b-9" reftype="term">points and fees</ref> payable in connection with the transaction do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-3" reftype="internal">(e)(3)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: For which the term does not exceed 40 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-D
paragraph.content: For which the interest rate is fixed for at least the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E
paragraph.content: For which the proceeds from the loan are used solely for the following purposes:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-1
paragraph.content: To pay off the outstanding principal balance on the non-standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-2
paragraph.content: To pay closing or settlement charges required to be disclosed under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref>, <ref target="USC:12-2601" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 2601</ref> et seq.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § <ref target="1026-20-a" reftype="internal">1026.20(a)</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-5" reftype="internal">(d)(5)</ref> of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s receipt of the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> or <ref target="1026-43-e" reftype="internal">(e)</ref> of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3
paragraph.title: Exemption from repayment ability requirements.
paragraph.content: Exemption from repayment ability requirements. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> is not required to comply with the requirements of paragraph <ref target="1026-43-c" reftype="internal">(c)</ref> of this section if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The conditions in paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2" reftype="internal">(d)(2)</ref> of this section are met; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> has considered whether the standard mortgage likely will prevent a default by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> on the non-standard mortgage once the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-4
paragraph.title: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms.
paragraph.content: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms. A <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> making a <ref target="1026-43-b-1" reftype="term">covered transaction</ref> under this paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref> may offer to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> rate discounts and terms that are the same as, or better than, the rate discounts and terms that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> offers to new <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>, consistent with the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>'s documented underwriting practices and to the extent not prohibited by applicable <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> or Federal law.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculations.
paragraph.content: Payment calculations. For purposes of determining whether the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s monthly payment for a standard mortgage will be materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, the following provisions shall be used:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> receives the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-A" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(A)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-B" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(B)</ref> of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date and the payment due on the <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref> date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(i)(C)</ref> of this section, the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref>, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph <ref target="1026-43-d-2-ii" reftype="internal">(d)(2)(ii)</ref> of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, <ref target="1026-43-b-2" reftype="term">fully amortizing payments</ref> based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Loan originator. The definition of “loan originator” in § 1026.36(a)(1) applies for purposes of § 1026.43(g)(5). Thus, a loan originator includes any creditor that satisfies the definition of loan originator but makes use of “table-funding” by a third party. See comment 36(a)-1.i and ii.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-Interp-3-i
interpParagraph.content: The date Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac (or any limited-life regulatory entity succeeding the charter of either), respectively, cease to operate under the conservatorship or receivership of the Federal Housing Finance Agency pursuant to section 1367 of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992 (12 U.S.C. 4617); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-ii" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(ii)</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-v" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(v)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-7" reftype="term">maximum loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-7-iv" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(7)(iv)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-43-b-3" reftype="term">fully indexed rate</ref> or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the <ref target="1026-43-b-5" reftype="term">loan amount</ref> over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is <ref target="1026-43-b-11" reftype="term">recast</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § <ref target="1026-18-s-5-i" reftype="internal">1026.18(s)(5)(i)</ref>, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a <ref target="1026-43-b-4" reftype="term">higher-priced covered transaction</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i
paragraph.content: All items included in the finance charge un<ref target="1026-4-a" reftype="internal">der § 102</ref>6.4(a<ref target="1026-4-b" reftype="internal">) and (b)</ref>, except that the following items are excluded:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-A
paragraph.content: Interest or the time-price differential;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-B
paragraph.content: Any premium or other charge imposed in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program for any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C
paragraph.content: For any guaranty or insurance that protects the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> against the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s default or other <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> loss and that is not in connection with any Federal or <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">State</ref> agency program:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-1
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the entire amount of such premium or other charge; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-C-2
paragraph.content: If the premium or other charge is payable at or before <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, the portion of any such premium or other charge that is not in excess of the amount payable under policies in effect at the time of origination under section 203(c)(2)(A) of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1709" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1709</ref>(c)(2)(A)), provided that the premium or charge is required to be refundable on a pro rata basis and the refund is automatically issued upon notification of the satisfaction of the underlying mortgage loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-D
paragraph.content: Any bona fide third-party charge not retained by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>, <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">loan originator</ref>, or an <ref target="1026-32-b-5" reftype="term">affiliate</ref> of either, unless the charge is required to be included in points and fees under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-C" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(C)</ref>, <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iii" reftype="internal">(iii)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-32-b-1-iv" reftype="internal">(iv)</ref> of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E
paragraph.content: Up to two bona fide discount points paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than one percentage point; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-E-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than one percentage point; and

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F
paragraph.content: If no discount points have been excluded under paragraph <ref target="1026-32-b-1-i-E" reftype="internal">(b)(1)(i)(E)</ref> of this section, then up to one bona fide discount point paid by the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> in connection with the transaction, if the interest rate without any discount does not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-1
paragraph.content: The average prime offer rate, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a-2" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)(2)</ref>, by more than two percentage points; or

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-1-i-F-2
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph <ref target="1026-32-a-1-ii" reftype="internal">(a)(1)(ii)</ref> of this section, for transactions that are secured by personal property, the average rate for a loan insured under Title I of the National Housing <ref target="1026-2-a-1" reftype="term">Act</ref> (<ref target="USC:12-1702" reftype="external">12 U.S.C. 1702</ref> et seq.) by more than two percentage points;

paragraph.label: 1026-32-b-6-i
paragraph.title: Closed-end credit transactions.
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">Closed-end credit</ref> transactions. For a <ref target="1026-2-a-10" reftype="term">closed-end credit</ref> transaction, prepayment penalty means a charge imposed for paying all or part of the transaction's principal before the date on which the principal is due, other than a waived, bona fide third-party charge that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> imposes if the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> prepays all of the transaction's principal sooner than 36 months after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>, provided, however, that interest charged consistent with the monthly interest accrual amortization method is not a prepayment penalty for extensions of <ref target="1026-2-a-14" reftype="term">credit</ref> insured by the Federal Housing Administration that are consummated before January 21, 2015.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-D-6-b
paragraph.content: Annual earnings that are stable or increasing are acceptable, while businesses that show a significant decline in income over the analysis period are not acceptable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-d-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> paid to an <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref> pursuant to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d-1-iv" reftype="internal">(d)(1)(iv)</ref> is not directly or indirectly based on the terms of that <ref target="1026-36-a-1-ii" reftype="term">individual loan originator</ref>'s transactions that are subject to this paragraph <ref target="1026-36-d" reftype="internal">(d)</ref>; and

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Total loan amount; examples. Below are several examples showing how to calculate the total loan amount for closed-end mortgage loans, each using a $10,000 amount borrowed, a $300 appraisal fee, and $400 in prepaid finance charges. A $500 single premium for optional credit unemployment insurance is used in one example.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-i
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for a creditor-conducted appraisal and pays $400 in prepaid finance charges at closing, the amount financed under § 1026.18(b) is $9,900 ($10,000 plus the $300 appraisal fee that is paid to and financed by the creditor, less $400 in prepaid finance charges). The $300 appraisal fee paid to the creditor is added to other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(iii). It is deducted from the amount financed ($9,900) to derive a total loan amount of $9,600.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-ii
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer pays the $300 fee for the creditor-conducted appraisal in cash at closing, the $300 is included in the points and fees calculation because it is paid to the creditor. However, because the $300 is not financed by the creditor, the fee is not part of the amount financed under § 1026.18(b). In this case, the amount financed is the same as the total loan amount: $9,600 ($10,000, less $400 in prepaid finance charges).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-iii
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for an appraisal conducted by someone other than the creditor or an affiliate, the $300 fee is not included with other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(iii). In this case, the amount financed is the same as the total loan amount: $9,900 ($10,000 plus the $300 fee for an independently-conducted appraisal that is financed by the creditor, less the $400 paid in cash and deducted as prepaid finance charges).

interpParagraph.label: 1026-32-b-4-i-Interp-1-iv
interpParagraph.content: If the consumer finances a $300 fee for a creditor-conducted appraisal and a $500 single premium for optional credit unemployment insurance, and pays $400 in prepaid finance charges at closing, the amount financed under § 1026.18(b) is $10,400 ($10,000, plus the $300 appraisal fee that is paid to and financed by the creditor, plus the $500 insurance premium that is financed by the creditor, less $400 in prepaid finance charges). The $300 appraisal fee paid to the creditor is added to other points and fees under § 1026.32(b)(1)(ii), and the $500 insurance premium is added under 1026.32(b)(1)(iv). The $300 and $500 costs are deducted from the amount financed ($10,400) to derive a total loan amount of $9,600.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H
paragraph.content: Income Analysis: Partnership Tax Returns (IRS Form 1065).

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1
paragraph.title: Description: Partnership.
paragraph.content: Description: Partnership.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1-a
paragraph.content: A partnership is formed when two or more individuals form a business, and share in profits, losses, and responsibility for running the company.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-1-b
paragraph.content: Each partner pays taxes on his/her proportionate share of the partnership's net income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2
paragraph.title: Analyzing Partnership Tax Returns.
paragraph.content: Analyzing Partnership Tax Returns.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-a
paragraph.content: Both general and limited partnerships report income on IRS Form 1065, and the partners' share of income is carried over to Schedule E of IRS Form 1040.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-b
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must review IRS Form 1065 to assess the viability of the business. Both depreciation and depletion may be added back to the income in proportion to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s share of income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-c
paragraph.content: Income must also be reduced proportionately by the total obligations payable by the partnership in less than one year.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-H-2-d
paragraph.content: Important: Cash withdrawals from the partnership may have a severe negative impact on the partnership's ability to continue operating, and must be considered in the income analysis.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after <ref target="1026-2-a-13" reftype="term">consummation</ref>;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph <ref target="1026-43-e-2" reftype="internal">(e)(2)</ref>, <ref target="1026-43-e-4" reftype="internal">(e)(4)</ref>, or <ref target="1026-43-f" reftype="internal">(f)</ref> of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § <ref target="1026-35-a" reftype="internal">1026.35(a)</ref>.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii-Interp-1
interpParagraph.content: Consideration of credit history. “Credit history” may include factors such as the number and age of credit lines, payment history, and any judgments, collections, or bankruptcies. Section 1026.43(c)(2)(viii) does not require creditors to obtain or consider a consolidated credit score or prescribe a minimum credit score that creditors must apply. The rule also does not specify which aspects of credit history a creditor must consider or how various aspects of credit history should be weighed against each other or against other underwriting factors. Some aspects of a consumer's credit history, whether positive or negative, may not be directly indicative of the consumer's ability to repay. A creditor therefore may give various aspects of a consumer's credit history as much or as little weight as is appropriate to reach a reasonable, good faith determination of ability to repay. Where a consumer has obtained few or no extensions of traditional “credit,” as defined in § 1026.2(a)(14), a creditor may, but is not required to, look to nontraditional credit references, such as rental payment history or utility payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumers</ref> Employed by a Family Owned Business.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C-1
paragraph.title: Income Documentation Requirement.
paragraph.content: Income Documentation Requirement.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C-p8
paragraph.content: In addition to normal employment verification, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> employed by a family owned business is required to provide evidence that he/she is not an owner of the business, which may include:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C-p8-a
paragraph.content: Copies of signed personal tax returns, or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C-p8-b
paragraph.content: A signed copy of the corporate tax return showing ownership percentage.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-C-p8-p9
paragraph.content: ```note Note:A tax transcript obtained directly from the IRS may be used in lieu of signed tax returns, and the cost of the transcript may be charged to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B
paragraph.content: Salary, Wage and Other Forms of Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-1
paragraph.title: General Policy on Consumer Income Analysis.
paragraph.content: General Policy on <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumer</ref> Income Analysis.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-1-a
paragraph.content: The income of each <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> who will be obligated for the mortgage debt must be analyzed to determine whether his/her income level can be reasonably expected to continue through at least the first three years of the mortgage loan.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-1-b
paragraph.content: In most cases, a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income is limited to salaries or wages. Income from other sources can be considered as effective, when properly verified and documented by the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-1-p4
paragraph.content: ```note Notes: i. Effective income for <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref> planning to retire during the first three-year period must include the amount of: a. Documented retirement benefits; b. Social Security payments; or c. Other payments expected to be received in retirement. ii. <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">Creditors</ref> must not ask the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> about possible, future maternity leave. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-2
paragraph.title: Overtime and Bonus Income.
paragraph.content: Overtime and Bonus Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-2-a
paragraph.content: Overtime and bonus income can be used to qualify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if he/she has received this income for the past two years, and it will likely continue. If the employment verification <ref target="1026-2-a-26" reftype="term">states</ref> that the overtime and bonus income is unlikely to continue, it may not be used in qualifying.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-2-b
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must develop an average of bonus or overtime income for the past two years. Periods of overtime and bonus income less than two years may be acceptable, provided the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> can justify and document in writing the reason for using the income for qualifying purposes.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-3
paragraph.title: Establishing an Overtime and Bonus Income Earning Trend.
paragraph.content: Establishing an Overtime and Bonus Income Earning Trend.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-3-a
paragraph.content: The <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must establish and document an earnings trend for overtime and bonus income. If either type of income shows a continual decline, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> must document in writing a sound rationalization for including the income when qualifying the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-3-b
paragraph.content: A period of more than two years must be used in calculating the average overtime and bonus income if the income varies significantly from year to year.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-4
paragraph.title: Qualifying Part-Time Income.
paragraph.content: Qualifying Part-Time Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-4-a
paragraph.content: Part-time and seasonal income can be used to qualify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> documents that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> has worked the part-time job uninterrupted for the past two years, and plans to continue. Many low and moderate income families rely on part-time and seasonal income for day to day needs, and <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditors</ref> should not restrict consideration of such income when qualifying these <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumers</ref>.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-4-b
paragraph.content: Part-time income received for less than two years may be included as effective income, provided that the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> justifies and documents that the income is likely to continue.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-4-c
paragraph.content: Part-time income not meeting the qualifying requirements may not be used in qualifying.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-4-p5
paragraph.content: ```note Note: For qualifying purposes, “part-time” income refers to employment taken to supplement the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s income from regular employment; part-time employment is not a primary job and it is worked less than 40 hours. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5
paragraph.title: Income from Seasonal Employment.
paragraph.content: Income from Seasonal Employment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-a
paragraph.content: Seasonal income is considered uninterrupted, and may be used to qualify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>, if the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> documents that the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-a-i
paragraph.content: Has worked the same job for the past two years, and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-a-ii
paragraph.content: Expects to be rehired the next season.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-b
paragraph.content: Seasonal employment includes:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-b-i
paragraph.content: Umpiring baseball games in the summer; or

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-5-b-ii
paragraph.content: Working at a department store during the holiday shopping season.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-6
paragraph.title: Primary Employment Less Than 40 Hour Work Week.
paragraph.content: Primary Employment Less Than 40 Hour Work Week.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-6-a
paragraph.content: When a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s primary employment is less than a typical 40-hour work week, the <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> should evaluate the stability of that income as regular, on-going primary employment.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-6-b
paragraph.content: Example: A registered nurse may have worked 24 hours per week for the last year. Although this job is less than the 40-hour work week, it is the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s primary employment, and should be considered effective income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7
paragraph.title: Commission Income.
paragraph.content: Commission Income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-a
paragraph.content: Commission income must be averaged over the previous two years. To qualify commission income, the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> must provide:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-a-i
paragraph.content: Copies of signed tax returns for the last two years; and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-a-ii
paragraph.content: The most recent pay stub.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-b
paragraph.content: <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">Consumers</ref> whose commission income was received for more than one year, but less than two years may be considered favorably if the underwriter can:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-b-i
paragraph.content: Document the likelihood that the income will continue, and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-b-ii
paragraph.content: Soundly rationalize accepting the commission income.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-7-b-p6
paragraph.content: ```note Notes: i. Unreimbursed business expenses must be subtracted from gross income. ii. A commissioned <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> is one who receives more than 25 percent of his/her annual income from commissions. iii. A tax transcript obtained directly from the IRS may be used in lieu of signed tax returns, and the cost of the transcript may be charged to the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>. ```

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-8
paragraph.title: Qualifying Commission Income Earned for Less Than One Year.
paragraph.content: Qualifying Commission Income Earned for Less Than One Year.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-8-a
paragraph.content: Commission income earned for less than one year is not considered effective income. Exceptions may be made for situations in which the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s <ref target="1026-36-a-3" reftype="term">compensation</ref> was changed from salary to commission within a similar position with the same employer.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-8-b
paragraph.content: A <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> may also qualify when the portion of earnings not attributed to commissions would be sufficient to qualify the <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref> for the mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-9
paragraph.title: Employer Differential Payments.
paragraph.content: Employer Differential Payments. If the employer subsidizes a <ref target="1026-2-a-11" reftype="term">consumer</ref>'s mortgage payment through direct payments, the amount of the payments:

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-9-a
paragraph.content: Is considered gross income, and

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-9-b
paragraph.content: Cannot be used to offset the mortgage payment directly, even if the employer pays the servicing <ref target="1026-2-a-17" reftype="term">creditor</ref> directly.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-10
paragraph.title: Retirement Income.
paragraph.content: Retirement Income. Retirement income must be verified from the former employer, or from Federal tax returns. If any retirement income, such as employer pensions or 401(k)'s, will cease within the first full three years of the mortgage loan, such income may not be used in qualifying.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-11
paragraph.title: Social Security Income.
paragraph.content: Social Security Income. Social Security income must be verified by the Social Security Administration or on Federal tax returns. If any benefits expire within the first full three years of the loan, the income source may not be used in qualifying.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-12
paragraph.title: Automobile Allowances and Expense Account Payments.
paragraph.content: Automobile Allowances and Expense Account Payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-Q-h1-B-12-a
